Review.Titre: Liars. My dog had an emergency and I never was able to talk to a vet.
Review.Contenu: My dog was having trouble breathing so I used the “I’ve got an emergency” and let them know his symptoms (trouble breathing, wheezing, whining, trembling, excessive drooling). I waited. And waited. Finally, I just had to take him in to the urgent care. Over an hour and I never heard back from PetCube. He has aspiration pneumonia and they recommend he stays at an overnight for oxygen but I can’t afford it. This was supposed to be my emergency fund but PetCube really screwed me over. Complete and utter liars. What am I supposed to do? Am I going to lose my dog?

Well that stopped the night vision on the camera working and nothing will have it fixed. While PetCube attempted to fix the problem their resolution of its out of warranty and therefore my problem was most unsatisfactory. So you outlay funds to purchase the item, pay for an annual subscription and in the end you have nothing. Clearly a disposable item. There are far superior products on the market. My advice is do not purchase this product. It is a disposable item with a limited lifespan.

This review is specifically for Petcube's emergency fund. I have not purchased any of their other products. I had purchased their emergency fund after pawp went downhill. $30/month for $3000 in the case of an emergency is not a bad deal, however this company sets their clientele up for failure. You must get approval from their vets prior to your visit to an emergency room in order for them to pay, which is pretty standard. However, they only allow you to text chat with the vet and send pictures/videos. There is no video chat feature. There is no phone chat option. You know, the options that would allow you to save time when facing an EMERGENCY. Oh, also, if your video clip is too large, their interface won't be able to send it to the vet. Their advice? Just take another video but make sure it's under 30 seconds. Or, while you're facing this potentially life-threatening crisis, just take the time to crop your video (assuming you know how), and then try re-sending to see if that works. Really stellar customer care here. And when I complained about this interface and it's backwards configuration in the face of an emergency? Whoops! Sorry, they can't reimburse me because I didn't get approval before heading to the emergency room. But they will "take note on my suggestion regarding a video chat feature." Real quality care, right there.
I bought the petcube a week ago and wished I'd gone elsewhere.Video is not clear, my phone is forever saying lost signal, and you cannot get a decent portrait view.It's Rubish

Why is it so hard (or impossible) for two people with the same pet in the same home to use the same camera? When partner connects his phone to camera, it boots mine off. We are in the same petcube "family" but he still can't see anything from the camera? This is incredibly stupid.Also, you might want to check the ads for your store. There is an ad for "Petcube Care Up to 90 day video history + pet and human alerts $3.99/month" and when I click on it, the 90 day video history is clearly with the $9.99/month? I think I'm on the $5.99/month plan but I have no easy way to check if it booted me off of this when it disconnected me from the camera.Also, camera doesn't seem to catch most pet movement during the night, very disappointing. Can't wait for a better product to come out.

If I could leave (( ZERO )) stars I would. Fist the set up is complicated. You have to scan a QR code from your phone using the camera. You have to just sit there and move your phone around until it reads it or keep restarting the whole process. Second- The subscription plans are very confusing. You have different options. BEWARE of the “promotion” for the Pet Care bundle. You will have to pay $5.99 each month for a YEAR. If you wish to keep the camera. Another thing that is confusing is that if you have multiple cameras you either have to pay 5.99 for each camera subscription or the premium 14.99 each month for various cameras. Third- Costumer service is awful. Sure they respond quickly, but only to tell you to wait, and wait, and wait, and you get my point. They initially told me 24-48 hrs. We’re going on almost 2 weeks and I still can’t use my camera. As far as the cameras go, they are okay. If you try to use the speaker to talk to your pet it is an extremely loud, and static noise that only scares my pets. It’s also blurry. All in all, just save your money and look for something different. I (( DO NOT )) recommend Petcube. Awful.

So much unhelpful in fact I had to turn to the retailer to get the help I needed to resolve my issue, and once the retailer was able successfully help me, the support team then ignored my request to send me feedback forms and ending my completely unhelpful conversation with them until they were certain that the retailer had indeed been able to successfully fix my problem, as if they had anything to do with that. It was a massive waste of my time and energy and I regret having contacted them. I suppose now I at least know better that they have nothing of use to offer if/when another problem with my products ever arises. The products themselves are fine, not great, but for the price that's perfectly fine, of course except for the one that didn't work upon arrival hence the attempt, and failure, to utilize the support team.

The company seems well organized and helpful, but the product was very disappointing. The features of the app and the product were limited in such a way that it altogether failed to meet my expectations and needs. Specifically, I was looking for something that would allow me to view my pet in real time whenever I accessed the platform. Instead, the petcube only provided snapshots of activity, which in my opinion, serves no purpose at all if not augmented by real time viewing. Perhaps I am missing something, but this feature was absent from what I could tell. I also did not feel comfortable with the privacy options on the app. It was very unclear if I was setting my options to the level of privacy I wanted. The app just wasn’t very user friendly or clear.

Review.Titre: The support team did their best to help …
Review.Contenu: The support team did their best to help me with the information available to them, although at one point they just plainly stopped responding to my questions.  I am extremely disappointed with the entire transaction experience.  The item was not delivered at the promised date.  I sent 2 Emails that went unanswered.  When I called customer service, it went straight to voicemail or a busy signal.  I finally got through the online customer service via chat and was told that the item was never in stock to begin with at the time I purchased it.  I should not have been able to purchase it if it were not available.  Also, I was never notified of any potential delays to the order throughout the time I waited for delivery.  I'm also very convinced that it would not have been shipped if I never reached customer service.   Meanwhile, the price has dropped significantly (50% down) since my purchase, and yet I still had not received the item.  So in the end, I paid a premium for a product that did not arrive on time, and I was very surprised to learn how the operations was handled.

Review.Titre: Absolutely rubbish - DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
Review.Contenu: Absolutely rubbish. I bought this a week ago from Petbarn in Australia. At first it was working okay. The live stream quality was really bad, like watching something with dial up internet, nothing but slow motion pixels moving across my screen which constantly had blurry colours interferring. Our internet connection is fantastic and we have never had an issue in the past, as we stream netflix daily. The 4 and 5 second clips were recorded with great quality but it would record EVERYTHING even when there was absolutely no sound or movement. Do you know how annoying it is having to individually delete 4 second clips that are recorded ALL DAY? I decided to upgrade to the optimal package which cost me $48USD as it promised to give me 30 second clips. Well well, much to my surprise it is STILL recording 4 and 5 second clips, no 30 second clips in sight. And to top it off, today, I haven't been able to log in all day as it keeps saying 'timeout' or 'data synchronization fail'.I am angry I wasted $200AUD to buy this stupid device, and then a further $48USD to 'upgrade' to what appears to be the worst product I've ever bought. Do yourself a favour and buy a baby monitor and stay well away from this crap product.

Review.Titre: it sucks when im in campus it dosent…
Review.Contenu: it sucks when im in campus it dosent let me talk when im out of school i rate this a one

Review.Titre: can't get it to connect to my internet
Review.Contenu: can't get it to connect to my internet, even got help and still could not get it to work.

Review.Titre: Sent me a super weird email asking me …
Review.Contenu: Sent me a super weird email asking me what I ordered (???) and then cancelled my order
Never got one, I would like to though. Don't know why I got this email.
Absolute rubbish. Has not once connected.Do not waste your money

NEW: Fewer than 5 minutes after the review below went live, I received an email from PayPal to say Petcube has refunded my money.  Interesting... But my rating still stands. If it does indeed take 5 to 10 days to process refunds, why was I not told that? Whatever,  now I can block all the emails from Petcube. ******I bought a Petcube Play to make sure my puppy is OK when I'm away from home.  But even when sitting in the room with the camera, the picture quality was poor and much too laggy to  really see what's going on. Attempting to view using a nearby cafe's Wi-Fi was impossible - the app disconnected after less than a minute and then refused to connect again. From reading other reviews, it seems this is an issue with Android phones,  so why is it marketed as being suitable for Android users? It certainly is not! But there's more...  I contacted Petcube on March 9 through its live chat to request a refund. Following the advisor's instructions,  I posted the device back to Petcube the same day.  As I used Royal Mail Track & Trace, I  know it was received by Petcube in the Netherlands on March 13. Yet all I received from the company were nonsensical emails, almost daily,  saying they hadn't heard from me and were going to 'solve the ticket'. Even replying to said emails didn't stop them coming. On March 21, I tried live chat again, was told my case would be passed to a senior supervisor. Nothing. On March 23, I used a feedback form - they really love those!!!  - to complain and on the 26th was contacted by a 'Senior Customer Support Engineer',  who asked for the tracking number.  I supplied it the same day and was then told I would receive my refund by the end of the week.     NEW: As of 3pm today there was no sign of a refund but it miraculously appeared almost immediately after I posted this review. And don't get me started on the constant emails trying to get me to sign up to their subscription package...
Product doesn't work, stay away

Review.Titre: Customer Support Lines All Disconnected, No e-mail response, wish I could give zero stars.
Review.Contenu: Prior to purchase, mid-November, I reached out to customer support via e-mail as well as a couple of phone numbers found online to ask some questions.  I received an auto reply to my e-mail stating they would try to answer my inquiry within 24 hours, and both phone numbers were disconnected.  Never received an e-mail response and it's now mid January. I sent 2 other e-mails after November, to no avail.   I did end up purchasing the unit on Amazon, just to see if it was a good option, knowing it could be returned.  My concern is if/when an issue arises, there is literally no support available.  I am curious as to some of these reviews implying they were able to reach a customer service rep...even if they weren't happy with the rep, because I got a recording that the numbers were disconnected.  The irony one day is I tried the first number online that popped up under their customer service number, and it was one of their competitors (!!) so I decided to give their product a try, too.  The customer support for Petchatz is over and above, though the unit is much different than the petcube Playcube 2...much larger, more expensive, but has some very, very cool features:  Two way audio AND video, a treat dispenser that can be activated via their app, and though not good for a cat, but if you have a dog, there is an optional 'pet call' button a dog can be trained to press and call you~!  How cool is that.  So at the moment, though petcube is functioning fine on day 4, I have no way of contacting the company for support. Ever.  The Petchatz rep spent over a half hour on the phone with me the first time I called (trying to reach Petcube Play 2 support) and since then I have contacted them 3 times with other questions, etc. and always reached a person or a voicemail which was returned within minutes.  I was even given the rep's cell phone the day I set it up to contact her anytime that night if the unit went offline...who does that?  So do your research, I am going to leave it up to my daughter, but extremely disappointed in the PetCubePlay2 customer service which is literally non-existent, and overly impressed with Petchatz at how they truly show they value each and every customer.

I received the Pet Cube as a Fathers Day gift. Great little camera, just what I was looking for to keep an eye on my fur babies while I was out of the house. The camera worked great for about 2.5/3 months, and then lost connection with my WIFI and would not reconnect no matter what i tried. I contacted Tech support and they determined the WIFI module was bad, and the tech offered to replace it. A few hours later i received an email stating they needed a receipt, i replied back letting them know it was a gift and I did not have a receipt, just as I had advised the tech this during the troubleshooting process. So now i have a camera that is only good as a paper weight, because they will not replace the camera under warranty like the tech said they would. This is why i rated it 2 STARS  UPDATE: A week after posting this review i was contacted by customer support (management, I believe) an was offered a replacement camera. Today I received my camera.It is a real shame i could not get support until i was forced to place a negative review just to get support.I want to change the star rating but for the fact the extent i had to go through to get this resolved i will move it up to 3 Stars. As my Title say Good Camera, Horrible support.

Would not recommend. Picture quality is ok, but the camera is unreliable. At least once a week the camera goes offline and I have to be home to reconnect it, if I am at work or on holiday I can't reconnect until I get home. For this reason I wouldn't recommend as it defeats the purpose of having a camera.

Review.Titre: It is a bad app doesn't work right and…
Review.Contenu: It is a bad app doesn't work right and have too pay for it.No Thanks.....

Review.Titre: - camera constantly freezes do not buy this
Review.Contenu: - camera constantly freezes despite me having very good internet connection (even Petcube support said my internet test speed was very good.- support is sometimes online and other times the support is non existent - not fit for use, I can’t watch my pets for more than 2 seconds (not exaggerating) without it freezing.- Also the sound it makes is deafening have to switch it off 100% of the time.- I will be returning this as it’s absolutely useless.

Review.Titre: Do your research before buying this product
Review.Contenu: While my partner is the main user and claims there is no issues, i continue to not be able to connect to the app. I constantly have to force close and re-open in order to connect. Sometimes it will continue to disconnect me several times.Video and sound quality is poor - and on top of that you need to pay a subscription fee to save clips and get notifications! If i knew all of this, we would have just purchased a furbo! Not very happy with the product at all.

After a rough start with my PetCube, Anna reached out to me and took great care of me. I was pleasantly surprised by how helpful and gracious she was towards me. She really took good care of me and turned the situation around by being so understanding and accommodating. This is the kind of service that will keep a customer coming back for more! Thank you!

This product needs improvement, it’s poor quality. When you’re trying to check up on your pet, you can hear your self talk, which is annoying and the image is not clear. When it dispenses treats it makes a mess and dispenses multiple treats instead of just one. Would I recommend this product, probably not.

Review.Titre: I am very disappointed in this product
Review.Contenu: I am very disappointed in this product. First when I'm at work and want to check in with my pets, it makes a "ding" sounds which sounds like a doorbell. That makes my dogs go crazy. So I have to keep the app open showing the video so the sound doesn't make them bark. The sound has problems with clarity. Often me talking is all garbled and unintelligible. If I'm not near a network like work, it disconnects and/or can't find a network. There are just too many problems with this product which I am returning.

Review.Titre: Petcube firmware update impossible with chat support
Review.Contenu: My Petcube was working OK, but recently I updated my wifi and it just would not connect.  The Petcube wifi set up is very complicated compared to the other 12 devices I have here at the house.  By far the most counter intuitive.  I chatted with support a couple times, and got it to work at one point last week, but since it kept dropping from the wifi and then would not connect at all.  I chatted again and spent way too much time trying to update the firmware.  It would NOT work.  In the garbage it goes, and I would NOT recommend this product to anyone ever, nor by another one, like they tried to get me to do.

Review.Titre: Just bought the petbite 2 days and …
Review.Contenu: Just bought the petbite 2 days and already mechanical issue. Called Petcube, they help to run some tests, but no result. Now awaiting customer service to respond after sending performance email to customer support. Hopefully, it will get fixed. Very disappointed.

I would love to give this a better rating, but just can’t. Every time I go into the app the camera is ‘busy’ and ‘something went wrong with the connection’ so I have to quit the app & re-enter and then I can connect. I was charged $10 for the membership even though I got the subscription cancellation notification email. Customer service was very kind and resolved the issue within 2 days. Motion detected at times there is no motion. Video will only run for 10 seconds even though motion is still occurring. Times when motion is happening, no video recorded. Overall, a bit disappointing. Love the night vision option: but manything was free and did day monitoring just as well.
I haven’t even received my items. Ordered Dec. 15 with proclaimed delivery by Priority Day mail on Dec. 20. It’s now Dec. 22, still no cameras. I am leaving for the holidays. Thanks - useless.

Review.Titre: I was excited to purchase this to see…
Review.Contenu: I was excited to purchase this to see my 3 dogs and be able to administer treats throughout the day but for what this cost, the camera quality is poor in my opinion so I am returning.
Customer service has been terrible.  I have been trying to contact them since the end of November and only respond to half of my emails!

Review.Titre: I ordered my wife's Christmas present …
Review.Contenu: I ordered my wife's Christmas present on December 8th and received an email the next day stating that my order would arrive by December 13th. On December 15th I called the support line and was told that my item had shipped. On December 17th I called and asked for the tracking number. I received an email on December 18th that showed a tracking label had been created that afternoon. On December 21st I called the support number again and was finally told that my order had been delayed because the particular color of camera I ordered was out of stock. While everyone on the phone and via email were very friendly, I felt like nobody really knew what was going on. I understand the enormous volume of orders during the Christmas season and I appreciate the difficulty of getting all of those orders filled and out in a timely manner. I would simply suggest a more transparent system when a back-order is inevitable. In the end, the product will arrive a couple of days after Christmas and I'm sure my wife will love it.
Received last week, worked for about 12 hours and hasn't worked since,  waiting on email from tech support

I purchased an original Petcube and was super excited when there was an auto laser feature introduced. It worked great at first, then a later update caused the laser to respond very infrequently. The video quality also was not great, which was a major decision in purchasing the new one. The video quality of my new Petcube Play is great. However, the laser feature almost never goes off. I know that it responds to a lot motion, however, I have been dancing in front of the camera, close and far away, and it just doesn’t go off. If I wanted a regular webcam, I could’ve bought one, cheaper. I really wish there was an option to turn on the laser automatically at intervals of every half hour or fifteen minutes. Right now, there is no rhyme or reason to the auto laser, and I feel like this is more software related because it happened to both my old Petcube and my new Petcube Play.I would love to update the firmware to potentially increase the quality of the device, however, in order to do so, you need to call the company to initiate a firmware update. Just why?Another frustration I’ve had is that there are advertisements within the app. Full screen ads that you have to close, which show up intermittently. If I paid for the hardware, I shouldn’t be getting ads in the app. I have it set in iTunes and App Store to disable in app purchase notifications, but they still appear regardless.

Had this about a month so far. Immediately noticed it didnt come with the bag of treats it was supposed to. No big deal. I had some on hand and I fire off an email. It was late on a Friday so I didnt expect to hear back before Monday. Stuff gets forgotten in packaging, it happens.  I signed up for the Petcare and was getting push notifications non stop. Check the account and notice it is constantly uploading videos even when no one (including the dog) were home. Watch one of the +60 video recorded past midnight and notice some sort of electrical interference the mic was picking up. So I fire off another email and turn off noise recording and push notifications (negating the entire reason I signed up for the $30 petcare). Sent the second email Saturday, day after first email, and again expect to hear something by Monday. Fast forward a week and still havent hear back from my emails. Ok, I'll call them. Sat on hold for 5 minutes and got the option for them to call back once someone is available. I opt for that. Now, 10 days later, still no call back. Still no return email. Still no items that were supposed to be in the box. Still no resolution on electrical noise. If customer service sucked but it worked as advertised, I'm good. If it didnt work but customer service was trying to fix it, I'm good. But right now, it can do part of what is advertised and I get ghosted by CS. Unfortunately I bought this as a gift or I would have returned it by now.

I bought a Petcube last year, and it worked fairly well.  Video quality wasn't great and the laser dot lagged a bit, but I chalked it up to having a bad internet connection.  Then before a long overseas vacation in August I bought another and set up a second camera, thinking that the petcube care package I had already subscribed with would cover both.  Wrong! I had to pay a subscription for each camera.  Kind of frustrating but too late to return it days before the trip, so I signed up for a month with the intention of downgrading later.  When got home, I unplugged one of the cameras and cancelled the subscription on that camera.  In December, I noticed that I was still getting charged for both subscriptions even though the subscription page in my app said I would be charged 0.00/month on the second camera.I have written several emails to the address on the Petcube website, with zero response.I tried setting up the second camera again, thinking that if I was paying for it I might as well use it, but in the intervening time we'd upgraded our internet and both cameras were no longer connecting. I kept getting errors when trying to enter new network details.  I contacted customer support for help with this issue but didn't receive a response until after I had left on my Christmas vacation a couple of days later.When I returned yesterday, I decided to cancel the subscription and simply unplug both cameras.  Today though, I was charged for a subscription (only one though, luckily!) and when I logged in to the app I was still somehow subscribed even though I got an acknowledgement email when I cancelled the day before.  I have now cancelled AGAIN.  We'll see if it sticks this time.This company is dodgy as hell and their customer support is terrible. Two stars because when the product works it's actually ok. My worst complaint is the push notifications that the camera had 'detected a human' when there should not be anyone around, and that I can't set up the app and connect on my husband's camera.  I wish I could get a refund but I won't hold my breath.  If you are considering going to a pet cam, please consider a different company unless you have some money you don't mind throwing away.

I have two cameras with Petcube and have only had to contact support once to change my email address. Petcube support was helpful in assisting me through the process of updating my email, however the process itself was a pain and required resetting of hardware and awaiting feedback from the support team (which was answered always within a day, but that's still a couple of days to resolve this issue). Overall they have a great support team, just let down by a lack lustre account infrastructure and a hardware model clearly built to require subscriptions for useful features whilst still missing the mark.Would I recommend these cameras? Depends on how techie you are. If you want a standalone straight forward solution, it'll do. If you want to integrate with your existing smart home environment, hard pass.

Review.Titre: The Petcube is good, but the necessary app is not
Review.Contenu: The Petcube, as a camera does what it needs to do well, the app however is pretty bad. It continues to redirect you to the browser which is full of pop up deals and is difficult to navigate when you need to take action on an app notification (new firmware).The setup process for the camera (via the app) is intuitive but it can fail and not provide a clear answer why to which you need to power cycle and disconnect/reconnect.If the app was more clear and easier to use, i would raise the stars to 4 or 5

Review.Titre: Great camera, treat dispensing and software let it down
Review.Contenu: I have a petcube bites, which I've had for about 3.5 years now. The actual camera captures a wide field of view, works extremely well in the dark, and the motion detection is quite responsive.The treat dispensing is poor, as sometimes the treat gets stuck, it makes a noise that can scare a dog, and the precision of the dispenser leaves a lot to be desired. Anyone crating their dog might get 1/3 of the treats into the cage.The biggest drawback to the product is the software. I have set this up in four different locations, and not once has the process been simple. It often involves multiple device resets and deleting the camera from my profile and re-adding. I have contacted petcube's tech support for help connecting on two of these occasions, including the most recent set-up. During this recent set-up, tech support had to delete the camera on their end before I could connect, even though I had removed the camera on my end. In addition, when I view my dog with the camera and disconnect, the camera in the app almost always shows as offline, and I have to go into camera settings to trigger it to show online again--not a dealbreaker but annoying. I found I would often lose connection after watching for a minute or so, and then wanting to go back and reconnect to watch again would require the short, but inconvenient workaround. Finally, the updates seem to come on suddenly with no warning and even on a strong internet connection can take a very long time to apply, all the while you cannot use the camera. If you are away, you only find out the camera is updating when you go to check on your pet and the camera is unavailable.All in all, I would recommend the camera, but would advise to check and see if they've improved the treat dispenser in the new iteration, if treat dispensing is a strong consideration for you. If treat dispensing is not important, I'd probably recommend a different version than the bites, assuming the camera functionality is the same across the models. The software experience has been bad for me, but tech support is good and responsive, so if you budget for a frustrating hour setting up the device, for the most part, you'll be smooth sailing afterwards.

Review.Titre: It's a good deal, needs some improvements.
Review.Contenu: I ordered the Petcube Lite subscription deal where you get the camera for free but agree to a 1 year subscription. I had been using a Canary camera with a treat and train on my dog until I saw Petcube and Furbo advertisements. I really wanted the ability to dispense treats remotely and the Treat and Train only gives you the option to dispense treats at set time periods. I got the camera really fast and signed up for the subscription. PROS:1. Camera picture is really clear and has night mode. Less blurry than my Canary and more responsive. Almost too responsive.2. Shipping was really fast3. The camera is super easy to set up and connect to Wifi. 4. Easy to move the camera around the house or to alternate locations2. The subscription deal is a great way to try out the camera at a budget price. CONS:1. The camera lens is on the bottom of the unit so unless it's placed on the edge of the the table, you see a lot of table in the shot. You can't flip it over or put it on it's side due to the treat dispenser. 2. The treat dispenser doesn't dispense consistently. I would say it get stuck and fails about 25% of the time. I bought the treats that were recommended for the device by Petcube and it still isn't consistent.3. If you crate your dog, the treat dispenser will be fairly useless. I tried positioning it in many different ways around the crate but the dispensing isn't consistent and often the treat would miss the crate or fly past it.  I fixed this issue by putting a tube over the dispensing hole with molding puddy and it worked great to direct the treat into the crate. The camera has to be right up on the crate though but I can usually see most of the crate. 4. The app is a little confusing and some things don't work. For instance, you are supposed to have an ability to time some dispensing but it doesn't seem to be happening. I also tried to invite users (my partner and some dog sitters) from the app and they never got the invite. So I had to just email them separately and ask them to download the app.5. The Wifi connection isn't awesome. It's in the same room as my router and I have fiber so the speed shouldn't be the issue and all my other Wifi devices work fine. I find it goes offline easily- though i can usually get it to connect at some point. I will admit, I had this same issue with my Canary camera so not sure if that technology is still not great or if cameras are just incompatible with my router...

*RATING HAS BEEN UPDATED FROM 1 TO 3 STARS* Petcube sent me a new camera following my negative review. Don't anticipate the same issue to happen again with new device. Original: Received a camera that has had intermittent connectivity issues from the beginning. Repeat lengthy instructions to “fix” the issue would fix it for a while until the unit finally stopped connecting altogether. When I explained this they again blamed my WiFi connection which is fine for all other wireless devices and cameras in my house. Weren’t interested in sending me a replacement so I finally just threw it in the trash and bought a competitor brand camera which has worked great from day one in the exact same spot.

Review.Titre: Product was easy to set up
Review.Contenu: Product was easy to set up. Unfortunately the video has been glitchy. Much more than expected since the product is pretty expensive. The actual product is very nice feeling and looking; however, what you get for the price for the video quality doesn't match. We wanted to love the product and give it 5 stars but the quality of the video and how glitchy it is makes it hard to do so.

Setup took forever despite having everything on and entered correctly and customer support didn't answer my only option was to leave a voicemail. Once up and running the app crashed 4 times in a row. The camera is great the picture is awesome and I love that I have the ability to talk to the dogs because one jumps the gate. Hopefully the app gets updated soon to fix the issues.

Review.Titre: The product gets 5 stars but the …
Review.Contenu: The product gets 5 stars but the shipping confirmation and tracking services were horrible. I ordered next day delivery on the 21st so the package would arrive on the 26th (day after Christmas). Got a notification that the package shipped on the 29th but that’s when it arrived at my brothers house. Guess it’s a Merry New Year then."

We just received this camera and the biggest pro for this item is the set up. The set up does not take long at all. Plug in the cube, download the app and connect! The camera has a fish eye lense that provides a wide area of view. The quality of the video is not as sharp as other cameras such as the Nest but good enough to view your fur baby. The camera is compact which provides ease of storage when you don’t need it. You can also leave it out and it isn’t an eye sore. Based on further use of the camera, the video connection takes a long time and the sound is poor quality.

Review.Titre: We bought a petcube bites and while the…
Review.Contenu: We bought a petcube bites and while the camera is great the Android app is prone to crashing and very slow.  IPhones or pads work better.  The feeding feature and the motion sensor are amazingly useful if you have a younger pet (Or pets)

Review.Titre: I think it is strange there is no Power…
Review.Contenu: I think it is strange there is no Power Button. A button would be preferred to just unplugging the device in order to take it offline.  Also, the sound quality could be improved.

Honestly, it's okay. When it works as it should - it's great. But it rarely seems to do that. I'm supposed to get notifications when my pet moves and I'd say that works probably 50% of the time. It bothers me that I can't shut off the laser completely. When I log in to the app, I can shut it off, but if I go out and come back in the laser will default to being on again. When I set the camera to "sleep" when I get home, it will still record motion (aka me walking around my apartment). This totally weirds me out so I've started to just unplug it when I'm home. Fortunately, it's quick to get back online upon plugging it back in. With all that being said, the video is clear and I'm able to easily save any clips that I want to keep. I just feel that for what I paid, it should work more consistently.

The social aspect should not be primary but secondary. Camera and camera options should be primary part of UX Design. You should also have controls for the Family camera share to maintain boundaries. I added family members without realizing they had full access and this ended up violating my privacy. You should have an alert when someone is actively trying to view your camera to allow or deny their access. The laser should sleep when inactive for over 30 seconds. The lights on the cube should also inactivate when not in use to not blind the cat. The laser should motion sensor the cats face so when it goes at random it doesn't go in the cats eyes. The turn on noise that clicks should be something more fun like a meow or woof instead of a chime. My cat responds to it. The two-way talk feature sounds robotic. Can't wait for them to enhance and update the cube then I'll come back and buy!

Review.Titre: I love love loved my Petcube
Review.Contenu: I love love loved my Petcube, and bought another one, but the app seems to have stopped working. If they can fix that, I'd highly recommend
I do like the Petcube; however, I do experience the echo effect when trying to speak to my pet. If that issue was fixed, I would rate higher.

UPDATE: Customer service has been very responsive via email. My cameras is now back online but I still have problems with it. It doesn't capture all of the movement and it shuts off on it's own (while I think it's recording). It's still ridiculous troubleshooting via email instructions. The reps are very polite though. If it weren't for them (Marina and Chad), I would have rated "Bad". My camera stopped working and customer service is only available by email which takes at least 36 hours to get a response. When Chad responded to my first email, I replied immediately and of course no response back, yet and it's been almost 24 hours again. I begged for someone to call me while I'm at home to troubleshoot but of course no call or response. If they do respond today via email, it will be a waste of time bcus I don't carry my camera to work! The audio also sucks too, the static sound scares my pets.  The camera I purchased on amazon for $35 is much, much better.
Poor sound quality, okay ish camera quality, but overall a good product. Gets the job done and was worth the cost.

Review.Titre: App is easy to use and haven't had any …
Review.Contenu: App is easy to use and haven't had any major issues. Wifi connection is decent at best though....

PROS: • I love the idea behind this. It's hilarious to be able to see what my cats are up to when I'm away. The video works in low light, so when lights off in my apartment, I can still see my cats.• A lot of video is captured and stored, I can scroll through and view when I want. Being able to turn Notifications on or off gives me control.• The start up manual was designed well and set up was easy. The app walked you through the process. Was using it within minutes of opening the box. • Customer service is very friendly and helpful.CONS: • I live in a small apartment, so this is bigger than I'd like. It has a long cord, but finding the perfect position near an outlet that also fits on a shelf is a challenge. In a bigger apartment this probably wouldn't be an issue. Manual suggests placing at least 3 feet above floor, but to be honest, that seems too high. Half the time my cats are off camera because they are low to the floor. • Start up manual doesn't include info on how to load the treats. The lid to the dispenser is hard to remove, so I started to doubt that was where you load them. Thankfully, you only have to remove the lid once in a while as treats need replacing. • Not ideal when treats are small. The dispenser shoots out 6 or 7 at a time. They kind of get sprayed out across the floor. My kitten loves chasing treats, so he seemed to like it. Initially, he was skittish because the dispenser is kind of loud. My older cat can't be bothered. I think it confuses her. Uneaten treats have been stepped on and make a mess.• Having to have wifi on all the is another issue. My apple Wifi gets hot so I don't leave it on when I'm away which defeats the purpose of having the Pet Camera. I didn't do enough research before I bought it as to how it works. My bad.
